column4: i didn't read the previous posts. what exactly are you trying to do. from your last post it seems you're trying to access a hdd partition from a livecd, so what's the problem. why did you mount per commandline and not per nautilus (then it shoudl be accessible in /media/{label-or-uuid}.

if you know how to mount an FS per CLI, do unmount it now and use nautilus (simply click on the FS in the Places list) then do what ever yo want to do. otherwise. if you're really sure you know what you are doing run "sudo su -" that will get you a full-blown root shell where you shoudl be able to do almost everything. (not advisable)
I'm not sure what FS is.
do a reboot and try again
